title: This Yankee Candle sale is the perfect excuse to stock up
text:
This Yankee Candle sale is the perfect excuse to stock up

You can snag two large candles for $40 at Yankee Candle right now. (Photo: Yankee Candle)

— Our editors review and recommend products to help you buy the stuff you need. If you make a purchase by clicking one of our links, we may earn a small share of the revenue. However, our picks and opinions are independent from USA Today’s newsroom and any business incentives.

It's cold, it's dreary outside (in some places, anyhow), and thanks to Daylight Savings Time, the nights are about to get a whole lot longer. In short, it's candle season, my friends. And right now thanks to a huge sale going on at Yankee Candle, you can save the kind of money on candles that'll make you want to stock up and turn into a total homebody.

For a limited time, you can get any two large candles at Yankee Candle—including best-selling scents like Macintosh, Autumn Leaves, Balsam and Cedar, Christmas Cookie, and more—for just $40. That means that instead of spending $30 per candle (the standard retail price), you're only paying $20 per candle.

More: 20 best stocking stuffers for everyone on your list

When it comes to candles that last and actually smell like what they're supposed to smell like, Yankee Candle is in a class all its own. Founded in 1969, this Deerfield, Mass.-based company offers a variety of seasonal scents and their largest candles—the size that's on sale—are a terrific value because they offer up to 150 hours of burn time and are made with natural-fiber wick, which is easy to trim and thus prolong the life of each candle.

This 2 for $40 sale at Yankee Candle is the perfect excuse to add a few new scents to your candle collection. Unlike with in-store coupons, there's also no limit on the amount of times you can use this sale online, either. So for instance, you could get four large candles for $80 (meaning you save $38), or get six large candles for $120 (saving almost $60), and so forth. It won't last for long though, so definitely stock up while you can to get your candle season off to a great start.
